turns.speaker: Speaker 1
turns.text: Welcome back to Maker Waves, the show where we explore creative product stories. I'm Alex, and today we're diving into sustainable audio gear.

turns.speaker: Speaker 2
turns.text: Thanks, Alex. I'm Jamie, founder of LoopLabs. We redesign consumer tech with recycled materials without compromising sound quality.

turns.speaker: Speaker 1
turns.text: LoopLabs just launched a modular headset. Can you share how the design came together and what challenges you faced in prototyping?

turns.speaker: Speaker 2
turns.text: The big hurdle was sourcing consistent recycled plastics. We partnered with music festivals to recover waste and invested in a new molding process that keeps the acoustics tight.

turns.speaker: Speaker 1
turns.text: That's amazing. You're also running a community repair program. How does that support LoopLabs' sustainability goals?

turns.speaker: Speaker 2
turns.text: Every headset ships with a repair manual, and we host monthly clinics. We want customers to feel empowered to fix components, extending the product's life and closing the loop.
